chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David A. Granum was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • David A. Granum was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court
Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay fines/costs/surcharges.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Provide DNA Sample, if not already done.  Pay DNA Surcharge.  Pay blood draw fee.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Participate in the Earned Release Program only if probation revoked.

Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations unless already completed.
Sign releases for agent so can verify if AODA has been completed.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment will need approval from agent if needs to work in an establishment that serves alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
6 months in county jail with 1/2 on home monitoring and Huber privileges granted for work/counseling pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 
2 days jail credit to be applied to first half of jail sentence.
Jail time to commence within 60 days.
Report to jail today for start date.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. Granum in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:36 p.m. Court calls case
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Knaapen does not have any corrections on the PSI.
Atty Lummis does not have any corrections on the PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant does not wish to speak prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 (amended) -
Impose/Stay 5 year prison sentence with 2.5 years initial confinement and 2.5 years extended supervision
24 months probation
6 months in county jail with 1/2 on home monitoring and Huber privileges granted for work/counseling pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 
2 days jail credit to be applied to first half of jail sentence
Pay fine of $1,200.00 + applicable costs
Pay $26.45 blood draw
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations unless already completed
Sign releases for agent so can verify if AODA has been completed
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment will need approval from agent if needs to work in an establishment that serves alcohol.
Maintain/Obtain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already done
Pay DNA Surcharge
36 month DL revocation
36 month IID in any vehicle owned/operated by defendant, effective today's date
Do not possess firearms
Participate in the Earned Release Program only if probation revoked
Jail time to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date

Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

Count 3 -
30 days in County Jail concurrent to Count 1
Pay costs including DNA surcharge
**any bond monies posted to be applied to fines/costs

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A. Granum in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
State files Amended Information amending Count 1.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  PSI would be requested. Free to argue sentencing.
Atty Lummis received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading.  

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders PSI. 
Count 2 is dismissed.

PSI to be provided to the parties atleast 1 week prior to sentencing. 

Atty Lummis makes statements and has informed his client of voting rights and not eligible to vote in this coming election.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David A. Granum in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Defendant David A. Granum in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.  

Pre-Trial to be Held Today.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant David A. Granum in court with attorney Chris M Lummis. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Intends to waive prelim. 
Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

$2,000 cash bond: must post $1,000 to get out of jail and the remaining $1,000 by May 12, 2014:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety while driving.   Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.   Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Court calls case at 1:20 p.m.  DA case #14PT856
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant and informs him of his right to an attorney.
State requests a $2,000 cash bond:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety while driving.   Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.   Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Defendant request $1,000 bond: his address is 2616 Ellis St, St. Pt.

BTC:  $2,000 cash bond: must post $1,000 to get out of jail and the remaining $1,000 by May 12, 2014:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
